H0.text: Fluorescence is the process by which substances such as minerals glow in characteristic visible wavelengths when exposed to ultraviolet.

H1.text: Plasma is the process by which substances, such as minerals, glow in characteristic visible wavelengths when exposed to ultraviolet.

H2.text: Chemical reaction is the process by which substances, such as minerals, glow in characteristic visible wavelengths when exposed to ultraviolet.

H3.text: Pigment is the term for the process by which, when exposed to ultraviolet, some substances such as minerals glow in characteristic visible wavelengths.

A4.text: When exposed to ultraviolet radiation, many substances will glow (fluoresce) with colored visible light.

A5.text: Fluorescence is a photoluminescence, the emission of light by a substance that has absorbed light or other electromagnetic radiation.
